caption: We loved it! The food, the ambience, the service. It was all excellent. Can't wait to come back!

Delicious food, really so great! Very generous portions for food, and drinks! Get the ice cream, looks plain on the menu but is extremely special. If you like coconut you’ll be in heaven! Hard to find a place like this in DC

Hands down, best Thai restaurant in DC, maybe around the DMV. If you’re seeking the mundane pad thai or drunken noodle, then go somewhere else (the restaurant doesn’t have them). But, if you seek to build upon what you’ve come to enjoy about Thai cuisines - the complex flavors and spices - then you have to try this place. We had the stir fried rice with pork bits and garlic shrimp, the Khao Soo Gai (northern Thai curry with chicken and egg noodle), and the beef brisket Panang Curry, and they were all very delicious. We’ll definitely be coming back here to try other dishes.
Fabulous food, friendly service (my experience is limited to take-out only) - they don't joke around when it comes to spiciness so take what the menu says seriously and have a Singha ready!

I love this Restaurant! the food we ordered all tasted very satisfying especially for those of us who are spicy food lovers.  the service is very good and the place is clean and comfortable.  it was a delicious dinner for us.
Wonderful food!

I've been here over 10 times. Amazing food. Great service. Extremely gluten free if you're looking for something gluten free. Honestly better than any of the Thai food I had in my 3 week holiday in Southern Thailand. Enjoy!

The meat Combo that followed exceeded every expectation we had, with perfectly cooked meats, amazing seasoning, enjera (Ethiopian bread) that was the perfect balance of soft/spongy/sour, and spice levels that made our mouths wake up and party.

I remember how sad I was when BaanThai closed on 14th and even though it was known it would be back, I thought it will never be the same... they’ll charge way more and rethink an already perfect menu. I have eaten at Baan Siam almost ten times since it has opened and it’s the same great menu, same great dishes and same great service. Same same hardly different, finally a place in the city that hasn’t jumped at the opportunity to squeeze every dollar out of a customer they can while delivering consistently flavorful and unique dishes. I love the location, it is so much more convenient for people living in South DC. Pork belly fried rice and khao soi are me and my girlfriends go to’s. ENJOY
(Translated by Google) The meal is delicious and the coconut ice for dessert is amazing  (Original) 餐點很好吃，點心椰子冰非常驚艷

my favorite thai restaurant i have ever been to. hands down. honestly best place i have been in dc thus far. food and service were amazing. we got the thai vermicelli noodles, mango salad, garlic rice fried chicken and honestly all three were 10/10. and the service was so quick!!!

If you like spicy Asian soups, and spicy Asian soups are some of my favorite things in the world, make sure to try the floating market soup, and as you enjoy the amazing flavor, be thankful you live close enough to eat at Baan Siam!
Amazing!! Love this place!
Friendly people, quick service.  The food was amazing!

Wonderful northern Thai options spiced to perfection. Highly recommend the yellow curry; tender, silky chicken falls off the bone. I love that they do their own delivery. A great DC business to support.

We ordered take out for restaurant week after hearing good things from other people. We ordered the vermicelli and the banana leaf chicken curry. It was very good. We also had the fried mushrooms. We liked the mushrooms better than french fries. We plan to visit again soon.

Tried this place because of their restaurant week deal: 2 apps, 2 entrees, 1 desert, and 2 drinks for $60. Everything was delicious. Order was delivered ahead of the estimated time (by ~20 minutes) so I'd qualify that as quick. We'll definitely be eating from here again!

Before they moved to their current location, we moved to NOVA and our trips to DC have been limited and we have not eaten here. Man what a sad mistake. We had a DC errand to run and got their Restaurannt Week menu for 2 to go!  2 adult slushies {lychee/vodka and yuzu/soju} were fun and survived a 30 minute drive home. The stars of the meal were the grilled pomelo & shrimp salad, and the spicy chicken in banana leaf. Both had layers of flavor and brought a nice spice. An excellent green mango salad and a crispy pork belly on fried rice rounded the meal out. Dessert was a griddle cake and was addictive.  Such an amazing meal and a total bargain at $60. Will be back. The food was too good and we were too hungry for photos.
Delicious food, polite staff, quick service - highly recommend!
The food here is heavenly. Every dish blows your mind.

WOW!!! BAAN SIAM 😊👍👍💯💯😍😍🖤💚💙💜💛🤍🖤 YOU are absolutely one of the top 5 Best Thai Restaurants i have ever had the pleasure of dining with in the🇺🇸 USA 🇺🇸 . I was not only surprised by the level of service but the very attentive management and respect given to all customers that take the time to come out and support the their establishment, and the food was Very Very Satisfying....it was so above my expectations it seriously blew my mind and gave me a Spice High🤪🤪💯💙💙💛!! Thankyou to all the service and management as well as all of the FOH AND BOH STAFF that I didn't mention.  I have been in the hospitality industry nearly 20 years and you all delivered excellent service overall so thankyou! 🤩😍😋💗🧡💛🖤💜🤍 "" Hey everyone this is kamal and I like to do reviews in my spare time from work and if you enjoy any of my post please like with a thumbs up and follow me on here on Google Maps or Instagram @chefkamalc Thanks and stay safe 🙏  mask up 😷
Awesome food, great drinks, perfect for take out or a solid date night.

Our favorite DC spot. Just got some New Years Eve take out from here. I cannot wait to dine in again one day. Get food here, it is delicious and even with take out, they bring their best! The Kanom Krok for dessert is not to be missed. I am astonished at how well it travels for carry out. A tip a good friend showed me... set your oven on the lowest warm setting and leave the Kanom Krok in the oven until you finish your meal. Comes out perfect every time. We love Baan Siam! See you in 2021!
The BEST Thai food in DC.
Great food and service.......

Baan Siam is a top-rated Thai restaurant in Mount Vernon Triange near downtown Washington, D.C. Here's why it's good:  - Food: If you like spice, this is your spot. Their version of green curry is called "Young Coconut & Chicken Green Curry" and it's spicy (and good!). The beef panang curry is also spicy and tasty. If you like mild, the green mango salad is good and uniqe.  - Service: Ordering online for pick-up was easy and it was ready on time. When we picked it up, the staff were helpful and kind.  - Space: It's HUGE and beautifully designed. They have a sidealk patio for safe distance outdoor dining.  I recommend this spot for quality Thai food in Washington, D.C.
The food is good,  you will not find Pad Thai on this menu, and beware...you can't specify amount of spicy or pepper on the food.  If four 🌶 s on menu then that how it is prepared, four 🌶 s spicy.

Absolutely delicious every time. Very vegetarian friendly, can sub tofu in many dishes. Heat level is on point: if you don't do spicy or only can handle mild, keep in mind their spicy is ACTUALLY spicy.

Such good Thai food, probably the best in DC. Just don't go looking for your typical/main-stream fishes. They cater to a more authentic experience and serve up dishes you've probably never tried before let alone heard of. Expensive, but decently priced for DC-standards: expect to spend ~$20 on food and ~$10/15 on a drink. I'll definitely be back.
Truly authentic Thai.
Excellent food and wonderful staff.

Loved it when it was Baan Thai on 14th, and it continues to be arguably the best Thai in DC. Keep in mind it's more authentic and exotic than your average Americanized Thai restaurant, so you may not recognize many dishes. For example, you won't find things like Pad Thai or "drunken noodle" here. But the food is outstanding if you're up for trying new things.

I had the Golden-Fried Pockets and Stir-Fried Rice with Crispy Pork Bits & Garlic Shrimp and both were delicious!!!!! Didn’t have time to take a picture of the rice cuz the smell was so amazing and I was starving 😬... highly recommended!!!  Second time: Had the same delicious Golden-Fried Pockets and Shrimp Stir-Fried with Curry Powder. I asked to be less spicy and it was perfect! A lot of shrimp, super tasty and also highly recommended!  Third time: Stir-Fried Glass Noodles with Chicken & Shrimp. Also amazing!!!! Sad that I didn’t try it before. I ordered the Coconut Milk Griddle Snack as dessert.

Really good food. Staff was nice and they have the regular safety precautions. For the amount of food I got, I thought it was a little pricey. I got a really good curry for $17, but my dish was kind of small, especially when my girlfriend got a similar entrée and got a massive plate. If we could do decimals, I'd give them a 3.6.
Spicy tilapia nicely plated and delicious BUT for $17 I think I received the lunch portion. The pics I saw online were much BIGGER. Take a look for yourself.

Met a friend for lunch and it was excellent! We shared the chicken wings and I had the Fried Rice with Crispy Pork & Gatlic Shrimp, and Mango Sticky Rice! Everything was fresh and delicious. They also had great social distancing and wonderful service.

Edit: October 2020.  I've now eaten here (take out) about a half dozen times and it's simply the best Thai I've had, anywhere. The flavor, the spices, all phenomenal. You can't go wrong. Delicious food.  First, major applause for opening during a pandemic. Talk about having to deal with an unprecedented wrench thrown into the plans.  I ordered the northern Thai pork curry and the spicy chicken in banana leaf. I personally thought the flavors were out of this world. Truly phenomenal. I love spicy food and I was sweating after eating these at their "normal, as ordered" spice level. I loved it! I don't think there's another Thai restaurant in DC offering these kind of flavor profiles. I recommend both dishes as well as the pineapple chicken bites appetizer. All delicious.  Cons?  The food was a bit too spicy for my wife. We both thought that quantity for the price point was low (but this was Covid takeout). Also, they could stand to add more vegetables in the dishes as well as offer more interesting vegetable/gluten free dishes. Like a simple spicy eggplant tofu with string beans would be nice. More leafy greens: more broccoli, spinach, etc.
Best Thai in DC. The Tom Yum noodle soup is amazing.
One of my favorite Thai restaurants. Many authentic food, drink was great moreover service is great. 👍
Drinks are ok, food was great! Recommend the eggplant/shrimp salad.
Lovely food, decent variety of vegetarian food.

Thai vermicelli in chili peanut sauce was my favorite plate. We shared and paired it with the stir-fried rice with crispy pork bits and garlic shrimp. The first dish was spicy and the second wasn’t, so they mellowed out quite nicely. Delicious food, would recommend any time 👌🏼

I've been living in the U.S.A for over 40 years and most Thai food I had are on the sweet side.  Baan Siam has the best Thai food, very authentic Thai taste especially KAO SOI and the coconut milk griddle snack which is hard to find in most Thai rest.  My friends and I will come back again tomorrow.
The same incredible food and friendly people in new digs. Possibly the one thing still sane in this world.
Great food with a focus on northern Thailand, which is less common. Good number of tofu and vegetarian options and pretty extensive menu overall. Nice patio seating spaced out well during covid.

The food actually did taste similar to what I had while traveling around Thailand. The two standouts to me were the mango salad (made with ripe mango, not green mango... not sure if it's usually made that way but it was still delicious) and the spicy peanut noodles. The banana leaf chicken was missing acid, but had a nice amount of heat. Grilled beef salad was decent but not great, the meat itself isn't very seasoned, probably because it's served with such a salty-sour sauce. Wish it came with more veg as well. Overall this place is fantastic and you should definitely check it out. Excited to return.
The food was delicious. Some of the tastiest Thai food I’ve had. The khao soi was super delish.

Frozen cocktails were delicious - we tried them for restaurant week - we got the pork skewers with peanut sauce and the chicken shrimp pockets - skewers were solid, tons of shrimp fish flavor in the pockets - nicely fried though. I got the green curry, it was very flavorful and had some heat to it. Was a bit tamer from a spice level the next day.

Excellent! I was a huge fan of their previous restaurant. Just finally tried their take out tonight and it was superb - the best takeout experience I’ve had. Everything tasted as amazing as it does for dining in. I highly recommend the crispy lotus root shrimp salad, green mango salad, and Khao soi gai - lots of spice.

We ordered during restaurant week just to try it out and it was AMAZING. Definitely going into our regular rotation. The flavors are so strong and interesting! We had the pineapple bites, lotus root salad, stir fried catfish and Northern Thai curry pork. All were winners, but the best was the slushies. Both the white lotus and lychees cocktail slushies were amazing. We wished we had ordered twice as many.

One of the more authentic Thai places in DC. Keep in mind that like traditional Thai places, it is SPICY! Really enjoyed the golden-fried pockets, grilled pork skewers, and white lotus cocktail. As someone who hasn’t had too many Thai desserts, I didn’t expect to like the coconut milk griddle but it was surprising delicious and hard to stop eating! The entrees were average but still a solid place to try out if you’re looking to try something new.
Excellent,  food and service was awesome 👌 Very affordable as well
New in my area and they had outside sitting.  The staff was attentive and gave suggestions on dishes. All of different dishes where music to my stomach.
Overall the food was good, only issue was I received a notification that our pick up order was ready 25 mins early.
Great quality Thai food. Plenty of spicy dishes. Plenty of dishes I’ve never seen before. We did a bottle of white wine, 2 apps, 2 main dishes and a dessert... the mango sticky rice was very tasty.
Very impressed! Delicious food.

I came across this place in yelp and wanted to give it a try. OMG, this place exceeded my expectations and it’s by far the best Thai place I have eaten. We just ordered to go and our order was ready in 20 minutes. The website was quite user friendly. The menu was huge and had lot of different items. We got 3 items 1. chicken in banana leaf- it’s a must try item order it without any hesitation. The chicken was super tender and the glass noodles along with it were very soft. The dish has an amazing flavor profile. It’s not that spicy. 2. Roasted duck curry- this is another gem, very different than the Thai curries I had. Amazing flavor with lots of veggies and the duck was cooked great. It’s a bit on the spicier end. Oh btw, the brown rice that came with this curry was out of the world. 3. Egg noodles- this one was different, not spicy but still had a unique flavor. I highly highly recommend this place. Fantastic job chef. Finding parking can be a bit of bother here..!

I've followed them from their days as Baan Thai and I can say without a doubt that they're one of the best Thai places in DC! They flavor profiles are just so great and I love that they don't adjust the spiciness levels!
Absolutely delicious as always. The dishes are flavorful, beautifully presented, and always delicious. The staff is extremely pleasant and helpful. The cocktails and mixed drinks are always sublime.
Excellent tilapia Tom yum
Amazing food! Spicy and so tasty! I highly recommend. We are addicted and order from there at least once a week. Very authentic Thai food with incredibly fresh ingredients. We can't recommend enough.

I never had a bad meal at Baan Thai (on 14th ST NW), and now that I finally got to their new location, it continues at Baan Siam. Every meal is served picture perfect, and is equally satisfying to eat. The staff are always friendly, and the prices are more than fair. Best wishes for continued success at 4th and I NW.

Delicious and authentic Thai food. This is my favorite Thai restaurant outside of Thailand. Try the Thai Vermicelli! Staff is always great, and they are doing a great job managing through COVID. I ate on the patio on my last visit and received complementary hand sanitizer for the table, and great contactless options for the menu and check.
Best Thai in DC, an improvement even off the original. Favorite dish has to be the Khao Soi, but loving everything they have on the new menu at this point.

A wonderful addition to the neighborhood! Food stays hot during pick-up and every dish we've gotten is delicious. Golden pockets for apps! Fried rice with crispy pork and shrimp, so good! In the few weeks Baan Siam has been open we've already ordered from them multiple times and it's just the beginning :)

OMG!!! Our Favorite Thai restaurant. So many delicious items on their menu! Chicken wings, golden pockets, green mango salad, sorry.....Everything is Amazing!!! No need for me to list the entire menu...BUT, mango and sticky rice dessert is delicious too!!! Don’t forget their drinks to go as well....frozen white Lotus, frozen Lychee drink..!!!!!
I recently returned from Thailand, and this is the only Thai restaurant in DC I've eaten at that comes close to matching the taste and quality from my trip. Keep it up!

We got carry out here because #COVID19. I have been to Thailand three times and loved it there, especially the cuisine. Rarely do I find Thai food in the US that gives me the nostalgia and transports me back...this place got it right. Fantastic.
Fantastic meal at Baan Siam.  Finally, a great Thai restaurant in DC besides Little Serow!
